meanings.definition: To divert or change the course of something, especially a road or traffic.
meanings.sent1: I had to reroute the river to prevent flooding in the town.
meanings.sent2: The construction work rerouted the traffic through the side streets.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reroute a stubborn cat can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected question rerouted the conversation to a more serious topic.
meanings.sent5: The detour sign clearly indicated the need to reroute around the fallen tree.

meanings.definition: To send something or someone on a different route or path.
meanings.sent1: The airline had to reroute the flight due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: The delivery company rerouted the package to the correct address.
meanings.sent3: I had to reroute my morning walk to avoid the noisy construction site.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden decision to reroute the hike led us to discover a beautiful waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The GPS app can reroute you if you miss a turn while driving.
